title: Hospitality Practical Competency Enhancement: Bilingual Switching and Inhibition Control-Based Mathematics Teaching Strategy Development

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can analyze cognitive load patterns in bilingual learners’ language-switching processes using experimental data.
Learners can interpret the impact of inhibitory control (IC) on language switching based on EEG data.
Learners can identify learning obstacles in bilingual math terminology transitions and design customized instructional strategies.
Learners can validate language-switching strategies using project-based assessment tools in large learner groups.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
